Tags: proof-by-refutation-1 python inclusion class

ProofByRefutation1Inclusion (python class)

See also

math concept | python declaration class | python sample

This section presents the ProofByRefutation1Inclusion python class.

This class models the inclusion of the proof-by-refutation-1 inference-rule in the target theory-elaboration-sequence.

Punctilious users do not need to instanciate objects from this class. In effect, the TheoryElaborationSequence class exposes the proof_by_refutation_1 property, and instanciation is automatic when this property is accessed for the first time.

class punctilious.ProofByRefutation1Inclusion(t, echo=None, proof=None)

This python class models the inclusion of proof-by-refutation-1 as a valid inference-rule in a theory-elaboration-sequence .

infer_formula(p_hypothesis=None, inc_hypothesis=None, echo=None)

This python method does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and returns a formula.

Note

Note the critical distinction between the infer_formula and the infer_formula_statement methods. The former does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula that may be invalid . The later verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula-statement that is valid by definition.

infer_formula_statement(p_hypothesis=None, inc_hypothesis=None, nameset=None, ref=None, paragraph_header=None, subtitle=None, echo=None)

This python method verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and returns a formula-statement.

Note

Note the critical distinction between the infer_formula and the infer_formula_statement methods. The former does not verify the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula that may be invalid . The later verifies the validity of the arguments, applies the inference-rule algorithm, and produces a formula-statement that is valid by definition.
